Woooo I have lots of updating to do. Here are reviews for Projekt Revolution, The Used, and Interpol. I know, my music tastes are all over the place. I'll start with Interpol because 1) it's the best and 2) it's the freshest in my memory and 3) this is going to be a really long entry, and Interpol needs easy access because I think more people will be interested in that than the others, hah. I got there way way too early. Who knew Interpol fans don't line up? I got there at 3:30, late by my standards, and there were maybe 5 people in front of me. After about an hour, two people showed up behind me. Nobody else showed up until about 6 o clock, an hour before doors opened. If I had known that I wouldn't have had to get up so damn early, haha (5 hour drive!). But it was fun, I made a little group of friends and we talked about bands and concerts and favorite Interpol songs. Oh, this homeless guy came around with flowers, and he gave me one and was like, "Oh yes, this a Red Indian paintbrush, blah blah blah" and I'm like aww thank you. And then he goes, "Got a dollar?" and I'm like uhh no. "Ok well I sell these." and he took my flower away. HE TOOK MY FLOWER AWAY. Hahahaha. It was so funny. The doors finally open, we all run in, but I do the same thing I do everytime I go to this place, I go the wrong freaking way. I run into this room and there's no one there yet and it doesn't really look familiar so I'm kind of confused. There's these two radio station guys and they're like, "Hey, how many people are you here with?" and I'm like uhh none...and they ask me...some other stuff, I can't remember, I'm still kind of looking around confusedly (is that a word?). SO finally I'm like, "Is this where the show is?" and they're like, "oh, no, that's upstairs." BSDGHDKSGHKSD. Thanks dudes, could've told me that. So I rush up there and thank god there was hardly people in there, it was like I never got lost in the first place haha. Most people were going to sit in the balcony, apparently. So I find my buddies and they muscle me in front them so I can see better (they were all a bunch of guys that were taller than me lol. not to mention i had been in front of them in line anyways). Well, in front of all of them except one, who says he'll squeeze me up to the rail later. He never does, haha. But it's cool, I was second row and had a great view. I was KICKING myself for not bringing my camera. I always forget how close the stage really is sometimes. Still mad at myself for that, especially after what happened after the show. WHICH YOU WILL SOON HERE OF SO SHH. After waiting over an hour the (very late) opening band, Liars, comes on. I'd heard from some girls who'd already been to a few shows this tour that they sucked really, really bad. So, they start playing (and the guitarist/backup drummer/backup singer is way hot, let me tell you) and everything sounds great. Amazing, actually. They focus on the drums alot and it sounds really damn cool. They did sound similar to Interpol. It was just really, really good. ...then the singer starts singing. Not even singing actually. You can't call it that. He screams. No, not screaming like an emo band might do. Yelling. Shouting. Not even like The Hives might do, although you could obviously tell that was his inspiration (he came on stage dressed in an all white suit). He just...randomly shouted things at the crowd. "AHHHHHHHEEEWOOOOOOOOHEHEHEAHHHHHHH!!!" and many, many other strange sounds. Everytime he'd do something, everyone would jump (because it was always out of NOWHERE) and look around at each other like WTF. It had to be the most entertaining thing I have EVER seen, no joke. He was a horrible dancer. He looked like he thought he was at an indian pow wow. He sang too close to the microphone, practically swallowing it, and it made things sound ten times worse. I feel really bad for the rest of the band, because they were amazing and he ruined everything haha. His microphone went out at one point, probably due to all the slobber he was getting in it, and he kind of freaked out. He's stumbling around, trying to fix the thing, it's not working, so he grabs the hot guitarist's microphone, sings into that for a little while, realizes that the guitarist is supposed to sing too, so he throws his microphone back at him, stumbles around looking for another microphone, finds a new one on the floor, tries to rip it out of its packaging, its not working, hes tearing at with his teeth, he finally gets it open, has to set it up some way or something, but he finally gets it and FINALLY continues his yelling at the audience. Oh, it was gold. So I have kind of mixed emotions on them. It was terrible, but also hilariously entertaining. And the funny thing is, their music is actually good. I listened to a few songs on Myspace and it's good stuff, he's just awful live I guess. Haha. So they're done, thank God, and then the real wait begins. I don't know how long we waited, but it seemed incredibly long. The roadies must've tested the instruments about 50 times each. My buddies and I talked about the opening band, said that if they could do it, we sure as hell could. So we're going to start a band, and I'm going to be the one who comes out, shouts something strange at the audience, and then runs backstage. I'll do that every few minutes. I'm gonna be great! AND THEN FINALLY OMG THE LIGHTS GO DOWN AND HERE COMES CARLOS AND LOOK THERE'S SAM AND EEE DANIEL! Oh my god, Carlos is the hottest thing alive. He walks on stage like he owns the fucking place, SO straight and tall, all slow and with kind of a swagger, and he's in all black with this long trench coat with an upturned collar, looking like a vampire, in cowboy boots....holy fucking god he's my favorite person ever hahaha. Paul comes on after everyone else, and oh dear he's adorable. His hair is combed down really flat, and he's got it tucked behind his ears. He's in all black, but he's got a little white sweater tied around his shoulders. He looked so clean and cute, hahaha. They open with Obstacle 1 and the rest is just history. It was such. an amazing. show. I'm still reeling from it.Everything sounded absolutely perfect. GAAAAAAAAHH. Paul was his usual serious self at the beginning, but after awhile he got really smiley and it was adorable. I was like YAY PAUL LIKES US. Daniel and his dancing...oh my god, epic. I love watching him. He was on the opposite side I was on, which is bummer because I could just watch his feet move all day. I don't even know how you would describe his dancing. It's just awesome, haha. At one point he RAN over to my side of the stage, played in front of us for about 5 seconds, and then RAN back to his side. Haha so cute. As is the case with most drummers, Sam was almost invisible. :( But hey, he sounded great! Carlos. CARLOSSSS. I just stared at him for about 90% of the show. The way he moves with that bass, he exudes confidence and coolness and omg. WHAT IS IT ABOUT CARLOS. He was right in front of my section, and he'd come over to us and point the bass at us and nod his head at us and smile with this "I know, I'm awesome" look on his face. *dead* This was the setlist in no particular order, including encore: Obstacle 1 C'mere Evil Heinrich Maneuver Pioneer to the Falls Leif Erikson Mammoth Narc No I in Threesome Not Even Jail NYC Pace is the Trick PDA Rest My Chemistry Say Hello to the Angels Stella Was a Diver and She was Always Down Slow Hands Take You On a Cruise They MAY have played Length of Love and Obstacle 2, for some reason I'm not sure. I kind of remember them but I kind of don't. I'm more certain on Length of Love than I am on Obstacle 2, though. I had heard that they hadn't been playing Angels recently, and I was kind of dying when I heard that, because Angels is my favorite song EVER. So when I heard the opening chords...haha, my concert buddies knew I wanted to hear it so bad, so when they started it, they all turned and looked at me like :O and I'm like :O and then we just all rocked out. I was so thrilled. Slow Hands was maybe the best of the night. Not even sure why but after it was done, I could hear a bunch of people go, "That was AWESOME." haha. It was though. Fun fun fun. Rest My Chemistry was SEEEEXYYYY. And so was Narc. Was veeeery happy to hear Stella, seeing as I named my dog after it and all. Take You on a Cruise was GORGEOUS, and No I in Threesome was tons of fun. Everything else....amazing, purely amazing. I really wished they would've played The New, Roland, Who Do You Think?, and I would've keeled over if they'd played Lighthouse. So you know...for future reference 'Pol, play those. Also, Next Exit would've been enjoyable. After it was over, Sam threw his drumsticks, Carlos threw his pick, and I got nothin'. Daniel stayed on stage the longest being a total ham. Waving, blowing kisses, bowing, shaking hands with the people in the front row (only on his side though, damnit). Aaahahah gotta love him. I hadn't planned on waiting by the tour bus afterward, because I knew how long bands tend to make people wait and I just didn't feel like going through it. But after the show, I got to thinking, Interpol were the first band I ever saw live (3 years ago almost!), they should be the first band I meet too, so HELL YES I'm waiting by the bus! And I did. Some lady says that Carlos already came out, got his dog off the bus, and ran back in. This is an amusing picture in my head. After only 20 minutes at the most...PAUL FUCKING BANKS. He runs past us all, saying, "just a second, I'll be right back!". I don't know where he went. But then he comes back, starts at my end of the line (thank god, otherwise I would have been there forever) and begins signing. He finally gets to me, and signs a shirt that my mother had bought for me earlier (so glad she did, I had nothing else that was signable lol). I told him thanks for playing Angels, he looked at me as I was saying it, but didn't say anything back lol. I looked down and realized he had signed my shirt in a silver pen, which didn't show up very well. So I'm like, "Paulll.." and he looks back at me. "Can you sign it in black?". And he comes back, signs it again in black, then continues down the line. He talks way too much. ;) Actually, when people said the show was awesome, he'd say thank you in the most SINCERE way I've ever heard someone say it. As if he was genuinely surprised people enjoyed the show. Like, "Wow...wow, thank you!" Except he didn't say wow, he just sounded like he should have. Haha. It was really cute. The people around me and I are looking at his signature after he leaves, and....well it's pretty amusing. The guy next to me's looks like it says "PIB" and mine looks like "RB". So, we've changed his name to Raoul. Raoul Banks. I realized Raoul stole my pen, and I was like PAUL I NEED MY PEN BACK! but he was too far down the line to hear me. Guy next to me: "Fuckin' Raoul!" Ahh it was funny. Not very long after Paul was gone (by the way, we have no idea where he went to. If he had gone to the bus or back into the building, we would have seen him. He just disappeared!), out comes Daniel and the keyboardist. When Dan gets closer to me, I go, "Dan, Paul stole my pen." He doesn't even look up and says, "Did he really?" Damn, you can't even look at me when you're talking to me? I know you do this every night, but come onnn. Oh well. ALTHOUGH, he made a point to give this girl's pen back that he used. I think I reached him on a subconscious level! Haha. He is the cutest signer ever. He's very slow about it, you'd really think he was doing some elaborate design or something. But no, he just does a D with a tail, looks a bit like sperm. When he was signing my shirt, he goes, "I'm not very good at this..." and everyone's like, "It's a hard job man." and Dan goes, "I know...the pressure.." He's too damn cute. I tell him he can't be much worse than Paul, and tell him he is now known as Raoul thanks to his sloppy signing. Dan doesn't get it. After he was done signing my shirt, I told him how awesome I thought his dance moves were and that his feet were amazing to watch. He looks at me and then just laughs and moves on. Lolz. So the keyboardist isn't far behind him, and I don't really know anything about him tbh, so I'm asking around for his name, and nobody else knows...BUT then some guy near to me introduces himself to him, and he replies, "I'm Dave". WOO. So I'm like DAVE, of course, HI DAVE. Oh, he was wonderful. Really nice guy, and he actually talked! He had these really cool rings on, and I told him so, and he went off about how they were from South America or something lol. I asked him if he was part of the band now, or just there to tour (which I already knew the answer to, but I needed some conversation material). He was like, "Oh no, bands just hire me to play whatever instrument they need me to...I've played guitar for the Black Crowes!" He sounded really proud of that and it was cute. He started talking about other bands he'd played with, but I can't remember any others. He talked about some other stuff, and eventually we're all like, "So you gonna sign our stuff, or...?" He looks down at our shirts and he's like, "Oh, what's this!" I go, "Why, they're t-shirts!" and he says, "Ahh, I've heard about these." Ahaha. AREN'T WE HILARIOUS. He has this really long signature. And really messy too. We were all trying to figure it out after he left, and we're pretty sure it says, "xox F. Dave Keys '07". So then we're all like, "Wtf? F. Dave?" and it's all highly amusing. I decided that it was like James Bond, so he is now known as Dave, F Dave. Awhiiiiile after that, guess who comes running out. Gaius! I think that's it's name. CARLOS'S DOG! It's just running around wagging it's tail and being generally cute. Not far behind comes Carlos and Sam. Oh my god I'm so dying inside, IT'S CARLOS D. My experience with him is very sketchy in my mind, I can hardly remember it I was so thrilled. I know I told him he was my favorite band member and he smiled, and I think I told him how awesome his coat was, and I think I told him the stache was lookin' awesome (it actually does look better now that it's all trimmed up and not in his mouth anymore). The guy next to me asked me to take a picture of them together, and I did that....that's about all I remember. Damn. I was just OVERCOME. Ahahaha. Fangirl. Oh by the way, we had been using this box thingy as a table for signing, but then the roadies took it away (it was a box of guitars or something like that and they were loading stuff). So after that I had to use my hands as a table for them. So yeah. CARLOS D USED MY HANDS AS A TABLE! OMFG!!!!111!!!1212!~``!! When Sam gets to me, he starts signing my shirt (ON MY HANDS OMFG). The pen isn't working. I look down..I had been looking at Sam, because I realized that, up close and with the short hair, he bore an astounding resemblance to Jack Bauer and this amused me. He's much better looking than Jack Bauer, though. AND I BET HE COULD SAVE THE WORLD FASTER THAN 24 HOURS AHAHAHHAAHAHHA. ahem. ANYWAY. I look down and I see that the cap is still on the pen and he's trying to sign like that. I'm like, "Uh, you might want to take the cap off." He kind of freezes for a couple seconds before taking the cap off. I'm like, "It usually works better that way, but you never know. Could try it to other way, maybe start a trend." and he's like, "No..no, I've tried that before. It doesn't work." Haha. And basically that's it. I told Sam the show was amazing and thank you, said bye to my buddies, kicked myself for not having a camera, and left. Went to eat at a bar/restaurant where minors were not allowed but I got in anyway, LOLZ SO BAD. Went back to my uncle's place, slept (not really) on a recliner, woke up the next morning, went home. Fell asleep as soon as I got home, woke up this morning pretty late, then started writing this. :) And it's taken me a long time. But anyway that's that. Oh, but here's some crappy camera phone pictures of the show. Mostly of Carlos, though. I didn't take pictures afterward because my camera phone is pure crap and I knew it'd screw any pics up. Actually, I DID take pics, not with the members, but of them, and my phone DID screw them up so I'm glad I didn't take any pictures of me with them because I would have been really disappointed. Wow. I also wrote this a long time ago and never put it up, so it might also sound a little stange at parts. Or maybe not. Went to Projekt Revolution about..oh 2 weeks ago (definitely longer than that now, see how long ago I wrote this?). Mannnn, oodles and oodles of fun. I was sooooooooooooo far away and I was by myself (aside from the strangers you always meet at concerts) but it was just awesome. It was UNBELIEVABLY HOT outside. It had to be at least 100 degrees, or at least the heat index was that high. I wanted to be all fashionable so I had jeans and BOOTS on. Bad idea. Bad, bad idea. I was buuuurning up. Thankfully I wore a thin strappy tank top though so it could've been worse. But yeah. I don't sweat very easily, and my shirt was completely soaked with the stuff within a couple hours. Soooo bad. And I could barely breath. AH. It was awful. They had two stages, a little one and then the huge main stage. The little one was up first. Madina Lake was supposed to play first, but they weren't there. :( I knew that before the show but I'd forgotten so I was really bummed. I like them. So, Styles of Beyond were on first. They were like...hip hop. Which is weird, looking at all the other bands that were there. They were okay. Not my type. They did sample an Arctic Monkey's song though. I think I was the only one there who actually knew they were sampling it haha. I left during them to go get a couple bottles of water. I chugged the first one in about 30 seconds. SOOO HOT. This guy asked me if I could put sunblock on his back. I don't think he was trying to pick me up, but I was like HELLLLLL NO. And then he left and I felt bad. He probably has a burnt back now. The was The Bled. Not good. All screaming. I like at least a little singing mixed in there, geez. The singer was funny though. I can't remember anything he said, but I do remember laughing. OH I remember this one song they had that went something like "Pizza and burriiiiitos, we want pizza and burriiiitos!"...seriously. Really weird. Thennnn was Saosin! Yaaaaay Saosin! The music was too loud though and you couldn't hear Cove singing very well. :( Very good, nonetheless. Better the first time I saw them, but still. The Mistletoe Jam was last night! It was supposed to be with The Killers, AFI, OK Go, and Jet, but ze Killers had to cancel because Brandon is all sickly. So Plain White T's took their place. I was unbelievably upset when I found out they'd cancelled, and I cried, and my mom didn't want to even take me anymore because she thought it wasn't worth it, and I was so upset, but she eventually gave in and took me (with lots of complaining). But anyway, Killers or not, IT WAS SUCH A GOOD SHOW.

So I wake up at 4:30, get showered and dressed, check the computer to make sure the Killers didn't cancel, and it turns out they did. I cried, begged mom to still take me, and on the road we were. Blah blah blah boring 5 hour ride in which we got quite lost.

We got there at...1:30 I think? with the doors to open at 4:30. I couldn't find a line anywhere, and when I finally did there were only 3 people in it. I was happy at first, thinking I was almost first in line but then after awhile when nobody else showed up I was thinking I was probably in the wrong place. So mom goes walking around to see and she calls me and is like, "There's a line over here with ten or so people in it" "There's another one over here" "aaaand another..." so I didn't really know where to go. We find out from a guard which (door is to open first, and THANK GOD, it's a door that's inside the building, so I could get out of the freezing cold. And sit down. IN REAL CHAIRS! Yay. There weren't many people there, and I was so happy, and then maybe 15 minutes before door-opening time, they tell us that people with floor tickets have to go line up somewhere else because they have to get wristbands first (???). So I get sent to this line with like 30 people in front of me. I was not happy, let me tell you. But I'm a trooper so I don't complain. I make friends with a few girls behind me, who in turn make friends with a couple girls behind them, so we have a nice little group. I was by myself at that point so I was really glad for that. We go in, get the stupid wristbands (THEY HAD ELEPHANTS ON THEM), and make our way to the arena. This place was even bigger than I was prepared for. It was amazing. And the best part about it being big (never thought I'd say that) was that there was PLENTY of room for me to get a spot up front. I was right on the railing, front and center. I have never been right on the railing before, so I'm just in lalaland right now. Oh and I lost a few of my little friends I made so it was just me and one other girl now. And then a couple of other girls come up behind us and ask if they can squeeze in between us. So then I'm not next to that girl anymore, and make friends with the new girls, haha. I met alot of people last night.

Anyway, you're not interested in any of that, are you? OK Go comes out first after maybe an hour, AND THEY WERE AMAZING LET ME TELL YOU. Damien, the singer (okay I know there's like 2 singers but the main one with the shaggy hair) walked into the crowd at one point. HE STOOD RIGHT NEXT ME. I MOLESTED HIS LEG A LITTLE BIT. The girl next to me held his hand to steady him when he jumped in, and she was so overjoyed that she gave me a big hug and jumped around with me, bahahah. They did do the little A Million Ways dance, and it's probably the greatest thing you will ever see. No joke.

PWT's were on after them, and omg they were so fun. Their music is just so cute and catchy and happy, and they're such adorable performers, almost annoyingly so, and I just loved it. They had gone on last minute to fill in for the Killers, so you know, good for them. I bought their album after the show.

Now, 90% of the people there were there for AFI, I could tell. So by this point, when AFI were scheduled next, it's getting squishier, everyone's getting excited, the stage is alot cooler looking now, haha...big white speakers, and the lights are being set up (finally...the other two bands had a very minimal light show), big huge white drumset, and it's just pretty. They make us wait for like an hour, and then the radio station dudes come out and tell us they'll be on in a few minutes. The lights go down, and then after 5 minutes, they go back up again. NOT COOL. And then after 10 more minutes, they go back down again. Then the stage lights come on, and you see some people walk out, but the lights are done so that all you can see is their silhouette. But of course we KNOW who it is and we're screaming our heads off. And then BOOM bright lights, loud music, AFI!!!! More screaming and jumping up and down and general chaos! They. put on. the most amazing show. SERIOUSLY. Absolutely stole the show. Soooo much energy. One minute Davey's up front, then Jade's up front and Davey's on the drumset, and then Hunter is on the right, and then Jade's on the left, and Davey's over here, and there, and someone's over here, god they didn't keep still for one second IT WAS AWESOME. Jade is amazing. He'd come right up the front and stand in front of my section and just go all crazy on the guitar. He's very bouncy. He jumps alot. He is amazing I LOVE JADE. But whenever Davey would come and stand in front, holy cow I got a bit friendlier with the rail. Everyone's reaching out and trying to touch him, the weirdos (I wasn't trying to touch him. No. Not meeee). He jumped into the crowd once, but over on the right side, not on my side (poo). They held his legs steady while he stood on their hands and sang. That was cool. But yeah, they put on an incredible show. Especially when they did Silver and Cold. That's my favorite song of theirs, so naturally I just thought it was the best thing I'd ever witnessed BECAUSE IT WAS. 

The girl next to me was...diabetic, or something..anyway, she got really lethargic because of low blood-sugar (we eventually got her a soda), and I was like, "Well at least you made it through AFI" and she goes, "It was AFI that did it!". Haha.

People cheered for like 20 minutes after they had left. Jet were supposed to come on next, and I was so worried that people wouldn't like them as much. I knew AFI were going to be hard to beat, especially since that's who most people came for in the first place. I didn't want the crowd to be unimpressed or maybe even leave, because I love Jet and well I just don't want them to have their little egos crushed.

But boy was I wrong. They gave AFI some really tough competition, and right now I can't even decide who was better. They played all the right songs, and that singer definitely knows how to work a crowd. He walked into the crowd twice (with the guitar, playing it all the while), stole some guy's beer, rub and kissed the security guy's head, kissed some chick's hand. A couple girls took their shirts off (left the bras on thankfully), and he was definitely pleased with that haha. Then some guy got up and took HIS shirt off, so funny. The drummer is SO good. He sang one of the songs, which I think is so cool because I don't think I could ever drum and sing at the same time. The bassist was crazy. At the end of the show he walked up to the front, slipped and fell. I'm not sure if he did it on purpose or not, but it didn't look like it. But he falls on the floor and is just laying for a couple of minutes, and the crowd's just like O_O and the rest of the band starts walking toward him, and the drummer kind of leans down and touches him and up jumps the bassist, haha. Gaaaah I just loved them. Singer interacted with the crowd so much, I loooove when they do. People cheered for them just as much as they did for AFI. I was so proud. I bought one of their shirts, but all they had left was a small so it's really short on me. I hate short shirts.

I didn't take any pictures because I wasn't expecting to have that good of a spot anyway, and I just wanted to be able to enjoy the concert without worrying about pictures. I really wish I hadn't done that haha.

The drive home was...bad. We weren't even all the way out of Atlanta yet when we hit a deer. A huge one. I cried for an hour. I hate cars. And the right side of ours happens to be wrecked. But I don't really care about that. I just can't stop thinking about the deer. I feel so bad. :(

(Oh god though, we were listening to the radio guys talk about the show, and the DJ was interviewing someone who was at the show, and he's like, "What'd you think of Davey Havok's eye makeup? All the glitter." and the other guy's like, "It was angry glitter. ANGRY!" bahahahah)

But I don't want to think about that, I'm just so glad I went to the concert. And the Killers are going to reschedule, and I can use my ticket to get into that, so it's all good.

I SAW THE STROKES LAST NIGHT SERIOUSLY!!! I know I haven't been to very many concerts, but this was the best one EVER. I have never had so much fun. EVER! Alright, let's start from the beginning. We left for Atlanta around 9:30. I wanted to leave at 8 but my alarm clock failed to...alarm me. So that was not a good start. Got there 5 hours later, plus an hour ahead in the timezone, so around 3:30. I had wanted to be at the venue by 4. But then we had to wait for my uncle to get off work because we had no idea where to go. We ended up getting to the Tabernacle at damn 5:30. I was angered by this, but the line was not so bad yet, so yeah lucky me. Doors didn't open until 7, so that was dull. And it was really cold outside too, and I had failed to bring a jacket. NOT COOL. But there were alot of really hot guys around so that kept me entertained, haha. There were 3 or 4 guys there dressed as Julian, which was cool because they really did look like him. One of them had that awesome jacket Julian used to wear, the black one with the red piping and gold buttons. Yeah. Pretty nice. Okay, it's 7 o clock now, the doors are opening, everyone is stampeding in. My sister and I sorta got lost first and ended up in the restroom instead of at the stage, hahaha. Idiots. Then we found it and pushed our way up as close as we could, which was pretty close. About 3 people back, which is close considering how squished together you are (which we definitely were). Eagles of Death Metal, the opening band, didn't come on until 8. THEY WERE REALLY GOOD. Surprisingly. I really wasn't expecting much from them, but man, really awesome. The entire crowd seemed pretty into it, although nobody knew the words. But you know, everyone's dancin' and groovin'. The singer kept saying that it was the best audience they'd had so far (but I know they always say that). He also kept telling us to "Give it up for the ladies" and then everyone would scream and scream and scream. He made us do that after pretty much every song, lmao. He also kept saying how hot all the ladies were. He was a real charmer, yes. Oh, but he did tell the guys to move back so that the ladies could get up front and dance. Nobody listened, but it was a nice gesture anyway. The drummer was a chick and she rocked HARD. Very very awesome. I think I heard about 5 guys around me say, "She's fucking hot!" Haha. Yeah. He took his shirt off. So their set lasted until 9, and the Strokes were supposed to come on at 9:15. Well, the Strokes are obviously much too cool for us regular folk because they showed up at 9:30, haha. OH. MY. GOD. The crowd went CRAZY as soon as we saw them. I mean, wow. Loud as hell in there, and I think everyone took 3 steps forward because I was suddenly much closer to the people in front of me. Julian did this thing where he staggered backward with his hands up, and slowly fell backward. You know, as if we were overwhelming him. The very first thing he said to us was, "You guys are really loud..." Hahaha! Hahaha aw. Gotta love him. They opened with You Only Live Once, which was suuuuuch a good choice. The moshing started then, but not too badly. They played Juicebox next, and then that is when all hell broke loose. I thought I had been in mosh pits before, but this was the mother of all mosh pits. I think my feet touched the ground once through the entire song. Everyone was pushing and shoving and I could just barely breathe, let alone sing along (but I did anyway!). Oh, and it was also VERY. VERY. HOT. in there so everyone was nasty and sweaty and slipping and sliding against each other and NGGGGHGHGA. It was pretty bad. The Strokes sounded really great though! I don't remember the order of the setlist, but I do remember what they played, so, in no particular order: You Only Live Once Juicebox Heart in a Cage Razorblade Ask Me Anything (Aww Nick and his little Mellotron. It sounded sooo beautiful. Julian called him Mr. Mellotron.) Electricityscape (Julian said it had gotten requested alot, so they added it to the setlist that night.) Ize of the World Vision of Division (SO psyched they played those two, because I wasn't seeing either of them on recent setlists and I was bummed that they might not play them. But they did! And it was amazing!) Red Light (Crazy fun, this song is live.) Is This It The Modern Age Someday Alone, Together What Ever Happened? Last Nite (more crazy moshing for this, but I was so happy by that point I didn't give a damn) Hard to Explain (BEST SONG OF THE NIGHT. The chorus is waaay too much fun and and and I don't know this was just great) Trying Your Luck (That would be my favorite song, totally glad they put that one in.) Reptilia (YAAAAAAAAY! You people haven't lived until you've seen this song live!) 12:51 Meet Me in the Bathroom The Way It Is The End Has No End (This was probably the second best of the night) Encore: New York City Cops!!!!!! (Poor Jake had been hoping they'd play it since the very beginning of the show, so we were both pretty thrilled.) I Can't Win Take It Or Leave It (GAH!!! SO GOOD! SO FUN! CRAZY JUMPING UP AND DOWN AND DANCING AND WAAAHEEEEEEEEY! A good closer.) So overall, it was GREAT setlist. It would have been better if they had played On the Other Side, 15 Minutes, Hawaii, and Fear of Sleep (just because it would be fun to scream "YOU'RE NO FUN!"), but I'm not complaining. And I have to tell you guys...even with that hair, Nick is still really damn good looking in real life. o_O Even Jake said, "I'm not gay, but he's pretty hot." Hahahahaha I laughed a little too hard at that and he laughed back at me. Alright, (more) pictures! Only half of them turned out, because I accidentally changed a setting on the camera without realizing it, and from then on the pictures sucked. But I did get alot of good ones. I'm posting them. Whooaho scary Nik. What is it, boy? What do you see? I really like this one, even with the blur. YEEEAH ALBERT! Funky hand sign! Unfortunately, that's probably the best picture I got of Fab. Julian's big head was always in the way. yaay niko Albert loves his guitar! (wtf is up with the scary hands?) Out with the cigarette, Nick! >:O Hooray mellotron Katie, I took these Albert ones for you, dear. And most of them came out quite nicely. no comment? cool picture. Haha, the other Fab picture. Poor guy. The pictures are going to get better, I swear. I just seemed to saved them worst to best. Pretty lights. look! Julian's a miraaage! give it up for fab's hair! hahah. albert. okay, this one scares me. he looks...piggish. I loooove this one (see, I told you they'd get better.) Who knew Nick had chest hair? nikkyyy I think this is my favorite. <3 Haha, nice face. But look how stylish! Hhahahaha! That's a bad picture if there ever was one. Nerd. hot I LOVE THIS. *squint* Yeah Nick, we know you're fabulous. yay. and this is my shirt: Here's some videos: 30 seconds of Razorblade Most of What Ever Happened 40 seconds of Ask Me Anything (sorry they aren't whole videos, but I wasn't sure how much space my camera was going to hold...plus I was getting pushed around alot as you might notice, and I didn't really want to drop my camera on someone's head.) So yeah, it was really the best time ever and I can't wait for them to come back. I ache from head to toe, and my voice is almost completely gone, but I would be reeeally happy to do it again.
